skill.name: stream-chain
skill.description: Stream-JSON chaining for multi-agent pipelines, data transformation, and sequential workflows
skill.summary: Stream-JSON chaining for multi-agent pipelines, data transformation, and sequential workflows
skill.author: DNYoussef

security_audit.summary: This skill consists solely of documentation (SKILL.md) describing workflow orchestration patterns. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or external commands are present. The skill describes CLI command usage without implementing any execution logic.

content.value_statement: Complex multi-step tasks require coordination across multiple agents. Stream-Chain enables sequential workflows where each step builds on the previous output, creating sophisticated pipelines for code analysis, refactoring, testing, and optimization.
actual_capabilities: Execute custom prompt chains with sequential output flow
Run predefined pipelines (analysis, refactor, test, optimize)
Configure timeout and verbose logging per step
Chain multiple agents for complex workflows
Store chain context in memory for cross-session persistence
limitations: Minimum 2 prompts required for custom chains
Each step timeout capped at 120 seconds maximum
Context limited to approximately 100K tokens per step
Execution speed varies based on step complexity

prompt_templates.title: Basic Chain
prompt_templates.prompt: claude-flow stream-chain run "Write a function" "Add tests" "Verify implementation"

prompt_templates.title: Custom Pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: claude-flow stream-chain run "Analyze requirements" "Design architecture" "Implement solution" "Write tests" "Generate docs"

output: Recommendations: Generated prioritized action plan with 8 items

best_practices: Start with clear, specific prompts that build logically on each other
Use appropriate timeouts (30s simple, 60-90s complex, 120s multi-stage)
Include verification steps to validate each output before proceeding
anti_patterns: Using vague prompts that lack clear objectives
Skipping validation steps between chain stages
Setting timeouts too short for the complexity of the task

faq.question: What tools support stream-chain?
faq.answer: Stream-Chain integrates with Claude Flow and works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code agents.

faq.question: How many steps can a chain have?
faq.answer: Chains can have unlimited steps, but practical limits apply based on context size and timeout settings.

faq.question: Can I create custom pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes, define custom pipelines in .claude-flow/config.json with your own prompt sequences and configurations.

faq.question: Is my chain data stored securely?
faq.answer: Chain context is stored in .claude-flow/memory/stream-chain/ for cross-session persistence.

faq.question: Why did my chain timeout?
faq.answer: Increase timeout with --timeout flag. Simple tasks use 30s, complex workflows may need 90-120s per step.

faq.question: How does this differ from swarm coordination?
faq.answer: Stream-chain runs steps sequentially (one output flows to next). Swarm runs agents in parallel for concurrent execution.
